instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN_R: What is P5VS4RS3_EN_R? P5VS4RS3_EN_R is an enable signal that turns on the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. The _R means the signal is asserted when the voltage is high(3.3v). .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Can anyone help me out with the 820 00165A?

5V Missing

<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN_R</SIGNAL> fluctuating

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Fluctuating how?
Do you get pulse every 2, or 5 seconds?
Or the voltage fluctuates continuosly?

What about <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> (L7560), <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Post some useful information; any history available?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Ampere fluctuates between (38 amp to 110 amp)

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Present (8.6 V)
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_R</SIGNAL> Present (3.3)
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> Present
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> Missing (5V)

*After removing <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR>

Pin 1 on <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR>   <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL>  Present

Pin 2 on <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> fluctuates
 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> Present (5V)

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
If fan tries to spin, probably more voltages try to appear on the board.
Check for pulse at all big coils.
Also check pins 1, 3 & 7 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for pulse at mentioned points (at same time).

Inspect <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> areas for corrosion.

If machine came from a client, didn't say anything?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I disconnected the  L7430 from pin 2

Pin 2 ( <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL> ) : 2 V on the coil 

All coil voltages are stable 

L7560 = 3.3 V
L7520 = 5V
L7630 = 1.05
L7430 = 2V (Pin 2 end of the coil is disconnected from the board)... This should be 1.2V, but I am getting 2V on Pin2 of the coil which is disconnected from the board. ANY Solutions?

You've been asked to do same checkings on the board.

Very likely corrosion on <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>, or <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> areas.
Maybe some problems around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, god knows.
We need some accurate information.

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
You didn't understand what trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> means.

However, now remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and test if get stable voltage on big coils (at least few of them).

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> : It shorted together for a millisecond 

Anyways..... I removed <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and still the same situation 

No stable voltage any other big coils 

Only stable voltage on L7130 and L7560

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
"shorted together for a millisecond"
Yeah, but expected reaction must be checked at same time; in this milisecond!
Not before, nor after.

Keep <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> out of board.
Now remove <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR>/65/66/68, one by one; keep <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> on its place.
Tell us when (if) voltage appears on the coils.

L7430 = 1.2V
L7630 = 1.05V
L7320 =1.6V
L7310 =1.6V

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing

I said to remove the mentioned resistors one by one and tell us when voltages come on.
Don't you want to help us to diagnose anything on this board???

"when I plug out and plug it back in to DC supply"
Are you using lab PSU, not original Magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I hope you've removed first <RESISTOR>R8166</RESISTOR> (not <RESISTOR>R8165</RESISTOR>).
Just need to know the exact moment when voltages came on.
Put back the other resistors and be sure these voltages are still there.

Now tell us if you get 1.8V at L7820.

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Pulsing (35 mA to 140 mA)
I removed all the  <RESISTOR>R8166</RESISTOR>  <RESISTOR>R8165</RESISTOR>  <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR>  <RESISTOR>R8168</RESISTOR> , one by one and all at one time...... No difference ...it is still pulsing...


After Removing <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR>

it become stable at 130 mA

I tested this 5 Times.... these readings are final and tested

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I was very clear: KEEP <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> IN PLACE!!!

You've said to get voltages when removed <RESISTOR>R8166</RESISTOR>.
I supposed all other resistors being soldered on board.

I asked you about [B][U]voltage[/U][/B] at L7820 and you came back with [B][U]current[/U][/B] readings.

Is really difficil to help you.
As you do what you want, instead of what is needed.
